        deltaY - amount to move up

      • setScalePower

        void setScalePower(int power)
        Set scale to an absolute value
        Parameters:
        power - Scale power. 0 is 1:1 scale, increasing by 1 doubles scale.

      • fromScreenCoords

        Point fromScreenCoords(double screenX,
                       double screenY)

        Translate point from screen coordinates to plot coordinates.

        Screen uses down-pointing Y axis and its (0,0) coordinate is in the top left corner. Plot, on the other hand, has up-pointing Y axis and its (0,0) point isn't fixed. This method converts screen coordinates (eg. coordinates of a mouse click) to plot coordinates.

        Parameters:
        screenX - X coordinate in screen coordinate system
        screenY - Y coordinate in screen coordinate system
        Returns:
        A point in plot coordinate system.

      • toScreenCoords

        Point toScreenCoords(double plotX,
                     double plotY)
        Method opposite to fromScreenCoords(double, double). See fromScreenCoords(double, double) for details.
        Parameters:
        plotX - X coordinate in plot coordinate system
        plotY - Y coordinate in plot coordinate system
        Returns:
        A point in screen coordinate system.

      • toScreenCoords

        Point toScreenCoords(PlotPoint point)
        Convenience method that calls toScreenCoords(double, double).
        Parameters:
        point - a plot point
        Returns:
        Point's position in screen coordinate system

      • visiblePoints

        java.util.Collection<PlotPoint> visiblePoints(java.util.Collection<PlotPoint> points)
        Filters points by visibility.
        Parameters:
        points - a collection of points
        Returns:
        Points from provided collection that are contained in this viewport.

      • pointAtPlotCoords

        PlotPoint pointAtPlotCoords(double x,
                            double y,
                            double radius,
                            java.util.Collection<PlotPoint> points)

        Returns a point closest to provided coordinates within provided radius.

        This method uses plot coordinates, use fromScreenCoords(double, double) to convert from screen (mouse) coordinates.

        Parameters:
        x - X plot coordinate to look at
        y - Y plot coordinate to look at
        radius - maximum allowed distance from (x,y) point
        points - Collection of points to search
        Returns:
        PlotPoint from collection points closest to (x,y), or null if there are no points within radius
